Package com.github.mjstewart.querystring.util

Class QueryString

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mjstewart.querystring.util.QueryString
  • public final class QueryString
extends Object
    QueryString acts as the private implementation to the publicly available methods exposed to thymeleaf in QueryStringHelper. All methods return the modified query string rather than return an intermediate state.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  QueryString.KeyValue
      Represents key value pairs and provides static factory methods to create valid instances.
      static class  QueryString.KeyValueIndex
      The overallIndex is simply the wrapped KeyValues position in the original query string.
      static class  QueryString.QueryCollector
      Creates the state map.

      • of

        public static QueryString of​(String queryString,
                             org.thymeleaf.expression.Uris uris)
        Constructs a QueryString instance.
        Parameters:
        queryString - The query string. If null sets the internal instance to empty.
        uris - Handles escaping/unescaping the string
        Returns:
        A valid instance

      • getOriginalQueryString

        public String getOriginalQueryString()
        Returns:
        The unescaped query string.

      • reconstructQueryString

        public String reconstructQueryString()
        Transforms the internal state map back into a query string.

        The fundamental concept is to use flatMap over the KeyValueIndex values. The actual hash map keys are irrelevant given each value has the key embedded inside allowing flatMap to be used like this. If the flatMap stream is empty, the key isn't included which is perfect for simplifying delete operations.

        Returns:
        The new query string.

      • replaceFirst

        public String replaceFirst​(String key,
                           String value)
        Replaces the first occurrence of key with value.
        Parameters:
        key - The target key.
        value - The new value.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • replaceN

        public String replaceN​(String key,
                       List<String> values)
        Replaces the first N values of the given key with the corresponding value.
        Parameters:
        key - The target key.
        values - The replacement values corresponding to the relative value indexes for the target key.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • replaceNth

        public String replaceNth​(Map<String,Map<Integer,String>> stateChangeInstructions)
        1. Accepts a map of instructions - {sort:{0:'stars,asc', 1:'address,desc', 2: 'country,asc'}}
        2. Convert into a list of StateChangeInstructions for easier handling. 
                   [{key='sort', relativeIndex=0, newValue='stars,asc'},
          {key='sort', relativeIndex=1, newValue='address,desc'},
          {key='sort', relativeIndex=2, newValue='country,asc'}]
        3. applyStateChangeInstructions(List) performs the actual replacements and returns the new query string
        Parameters:
        stateChangeInstructions - The map of instructions produced by the SpEL expression.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • removeFirst

        public String removeFirst​(String key)
        Removes the first occurrence of the supplied key. If there are no duplicate keys, the entire key will be removed.
        Parameters:
        key - The target key.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • removeAll

        public String removeAll​(List<String> keys)
        Removes every key and their associated values.
        Parameters:
        keys - The target keys.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null, empty or all keys are removed.

      • removeN

        public String removeN​(String key,
                      int n)
        The same concept as dropN in functional languages where the first n occurrences of the target key are removed.
        Parameters:
        key - The target key.
        n - Total occurrences of the key to remove.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • removeNth

        public String removeNth​(String key,
                        int nthIndex)
        Removes the nth relative index of the given key. Example of relative index is below where you simply visualise a key as having all its values contained in an array and providing the corresponding index. 
             a=100&b=200&a=300

           0     1   (relative indexes)
     a = [100, 300]

     removeNth('a', 1) => a=100&b=200
        Parameters:
        key - The target key.
        nthIndex - The relative index to remove.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • removeManyNth

        public String removeManyNth​(String key,
                            List<Integer> relativeIndexes)
        Similar to removeNth(String, int), except multiple values can be removed for a matching key through providing many relative indexes while maintaining their ordering in the original query string. 
             a=100&b=200&a=300&a=500

           0     1    2   (relative indexes)
     a = [100, 300, 500]

     removeNth('a', [0, 2]) => b=200&a=300
        Parameters:
        key - The target key.
        relativeIndexes - The relative indexes to remove.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • adjustNumericValueBy

        public String adjustNumericValueBy​(String key,
                                   List<Integer> relativeIndexes,
                                   int value)
        See adjustNumericValueBy(String, List, int, Predicate). This method always returns true for the predicate meaning the value will be updated regardless.
        Parameters:
        key - The target key.
        relativeIndexes - The list of indexes.
        value - The value to add to the existing value.
        Returns:
        The new query string.

      • adjustNumericValueBy

        public String adjustNumericValueBy​(String key,
                                   List<Integer> relativeIndexes,
                                   int value,
                                   Predicate<Integer> predicate)
        The values are retrieved for the given key and if the value is numeric it will have the value added to it only if the supplied predicate is true. The predicate is passed in the current value allowing a decision to be made which is useful for preventing a number going beyond or below a threshold.

        To decrement, the value is to be negative.

        relativeIndexes are provided for flexibility to update more than 1 value, however if the page is being incremented for example, the list will contain 0 which implies 'only update the first occurrence of the page value'

        Parameters:
        key - The target key.
        relativeIndexes - The list of indexes.
        value - The value to add to the existing value.
        predicate - Gets passed on the current value and if true permits the value being added to the current value.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • removeKeyMatchingValue

        public String removeKeyMatchingValue​(String key,
                                     String valueMatch)
        Removes the target key if its value is equal to the matching value. The equality is case sensitive. 
             a=500&b=700&a=700

     removeKeyMatchingValue('a', '700') => a=500&b=700
        Parameters:
        key - The target key to delete if the value matches.
        valueMatch - The value to match which triggers deletion.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • removeAnyKeyMatchingValue

        public String removeAnyKeyMatchingValue​(String valueMatch)
        Similar to removeKeyMatchingValue(String, String) except ALL keys are deleted if they have a matching value. 
             a=500&b=700&a=700

     removeKeyMatchingValue('700') => a=500
        Parameters:
        valueMatch - The value to match triggering deletion.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • keepSortField

        public String keepSortField​(String sortField)
        Removes all existing 'sort' keys and keeps the supplied sortField should it already exist as a sort key. If the sortField does not appear under a 'sort' key then ALL sort keys are removed.
        Parameters:
        sortField - The sort field to keep.
        Returns:
        The new query string.

      • getFirstValue

        public String getFirstValue​(String key)
        Gets the value associated with the first occurrence of the given key. 
             a=500&b=600&a=700

     getFirstValue('a') => 500
        Parameters:
        key - The target key.
        Returns:
        The associated value if found otherwise null.

      • getAllValues

        public List<String> getAllValues​(String key)
        Gets all value associated with the the given key. 
             a=500&b=600&a=700

     getFirstValue('a') => [500, 700]
        Parameters:
        key - The target key.
        Returns:
        The associated values if found otherwise an empty list.

      • add

        public String add​(String key,
                  String value)
        Adds the given key and value to the end of the query string. 
             a=500&b=600
     add('c', '700') => a=500&b=600&c=700

        Note: If the key already exists with the given value it is ignored.

        Parameters:
        key - The new key.
        value - The new value.
        Returns:
        The new query string.

      • addAll

        public String addAll​(List<List<String>> keyValuePairs)
        Adds all key value pairs to the end of the query string only if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        keyValuePairs - The key/value pairs to add.
        Returns:
        The new query string.

      • isFieldSorted

        public boolean isFieldSorted​(String field)
        Parameters:
        field - The sort field.
        Returns:
        true if the field appears under a 'sort' key.

      • toggleSortDefaultAsc

        public String toggleSortDefaultAsc​(String sortField)
        Toggles the supplied sortField between ascending or descending. If there is no current sort direction defined, the default 'ascending' direction determines the next direction to be 'descending'.
        Parameters:
        sortField - The field to sort.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • toggleSortDefaultDesc

        public String toggleSortDefaultDesc​(String sortField)
        Toggles the supplied sortField between ascending or descending. If there is no current sort direction defined, the default 'descending' direction determines the next direction to be'ascending'.
        Parameters:
        sortField - The field to sort.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • setSortDirection

        public String setSortDirection​(String sortField,
                               Function<SortDirection,SortDirection> sortDirectionMapper)
        Uses the spring convention of the 'sort' key to locate the supplied sortField. If the sortField is found then new sort direction is changed to the result of applying the sortDirectionMapper function.
        Parameters:
        sortField - The field to sort.
        sortDirectionMapper - Function that accepts the current sort direction and returns the new sort direction.
        Returns:
        The new query string or an empty string if the original query string is null or empty.

      • getState

        public Map<String,List<QueryString.KeyValueIndex>> getState()
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable state map.

      • getNextOverallIndex

        public int getNextOverallIndex()
        Since a Map is used for state, an overall index is used to reconstruct the query string in the exact same order. For example, if the current query string has 5 keys and we want to add to the end, the next overall index would be 5 given 0 based indexing.
        Returns:
        The next available index representing the max overall index + 1.
